poem:
Sympathy Groups

In the small tavern of our lives,  
trust sits like an old leather chair.  
We gather in the half-light,  
our voices rising with the smoke.  
Here, belief is braided,  
each strand a story,  
woven in the loom of shared care—  
a tapestry of human hands  
crafting a closer world.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
